page.title: 12ST. JOHN OF GOD HOSPITAL
page.content: The Manor House in Scorton had belonged for over three hundred years to the Tancred family,and had later become a boarding school for girls run by nuns of the Order of the Poor Clares.In 1857 the nuns moved their school to Darlington,and let the buiding to a Mr.Pollock for use as a boys' school until it was bought by its present owners in 1880. Brothers from France and Ireland were invited by Father Henry Collins,a Cistercian monk,to see if the Manor House would be suitable for them to use as a house of hospitality.Although the property was out in the country there was a railway station at Scorton and it was not far from the market town of Richmond.Two rooms in the house were turned into wards for the old,crippled or infirm.
